It happened again the other night. We're watching the weather report on television. A generic-looking man in a generic-looking suit slides back and forth before a map of the region, telling us we have nothing to worry about. Only a slight chance of an isolated thunderstorm after midnight. It is 6:30 p.m. He smiles, tells us to have a great evening and fades away to sports.

Less than an hour later, it's pouring. And I mean pouring. It remains one of life's little mysteries to me how such well-intentioned and well-trained people using such high-tech equipment can be so wrong, and so often.
